model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain information that is both useful and relevant, enabling the Speaker B to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the DIALOGUE CONTEXT. It is therefore important to ensure that the MEMORY contains only the information that is necessary for the response to be appropriate and effective.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I would tell about my progress of planning my trip to Sweden.
Speaker B: How is the trip to Sweden going anyways?
Speaker A: I am still in the planning stages, since my cousin lives over there, she is helping me to plan it. Any must sees while I am there?
Speaker B: It really depends! Personally, I love the castles! Visby is probably my favorite spot. 
Speaker A: Okay, I will see if there are any castles near where we will be. Do you have any plans to go back to sweden?
Speaker B: Not in the near future, but I'm hoping to get back next summer. I love hitting up all the local beach spots with my old friends.
Speaker A: That sounds nice! So how is your job going?
Speaker B: Always interesting, that's for sure! I have been training to nurse on a new floor, so that'll give me a change of scenery.
Speaker A: Does that add a lot of extra work to your plate?
Speaker B: At the moment, yes. I'll be in Pediatrics, which has always been my passion. It's a completely different environment than the ER.
Speaker A: Oh wow! That is so exciting for you. Will you get to stay in pediatrics after the training is complete? 

MEMORY 1:
Speaker A has a cousin in Sweden but has not visited the country. Speaker B has not visited Sweden for a long time due to the high expenses. Speaker A and Speaker B plan to travel to Sweden together. Speaker B is from Sweden and mentioned playing tennis and going to church on Sunday. Speaker A is considering visiting their cousin in Sweden and needs to save money for the trip. Speaker A and Speaker B plan to travel to Sweden together.

MEMORY 2:
User Description: Speaker A is a scientist who is considering taking a second part-time job to save money for a trip to Sweden to visit their cousin. They enjoy decompressing and being active in their free time. 

Relationship Description: Speaker A has been talking to their cousin in Sweden and needs to start saving money to visit. Speaker B's parents live in Sweden, and their job at the hospital offers flexible hours. 

Event Description: Speaker A likes to check out local music and coffee shops for conversations. Speaker B loves coffee shops and grew up in Sweden, enjoying good coffee and chocolates. They both share a love for music, with Speaker A recommending American hip hop artists to Speaker B. Speaker A is also interested in jamband music and classic reggae. Speaker B misses Sweden and has many great memories there.

YOUR OUTPUT:
prediction:
Explanation: MEMORY 2 provides relevant information about Speaker B's connection to Sweden, which includes personal ties to the country such as their parents living there. This gives context to Speaker B's desire to return to Sweden and adds depth to their mention of loving local beach spots and old friends, which is relevant to the dialogue. MEMORY 2 also mentions Speaker B's love of coffee shops, overlapping with Speaker A's interest, possibly providing additional context for the interaction. In contrast, MEMORY 1 contains some repetitive and unclear information such as Speaker A and Speaker B planning to travel together to Sweden, which is not mentioned in the dialogue context. Moreover, it does not connect with the current topic about Speaker B's new work environment in Pediatrics, while MEMORY 2, being more comprehensive, forms a basis on which the conversation can build.

Choice: 2
